critique: This document pertains to the National Industrial Recovery Act and the Lumber Code Authority. It focuses on fair competition within the lumber industry and incorporates forest conservation provisions. Given the time period (1930s), the context is the Great Depression and the New Deal era, characterized by significant government intervention in the economy. Ideological Tilt: The document reflects a liberal approach due to its interventionist nature, aiming to regulate industry and promote conservation.
